FORWARD_DEFENCE.name: Forward Defence
FORWARD_DEFENCE.description: A defensive shot used to safely stop the ball by stepping forward and presenting a straight bat

steps: Watch the ball closely and judge the length early
Step forward with the front foot towards the pitch of the ball
Keep your head and eyes over the front knee
Bring the bat down vertically close to the pad
Meet the ball under your eyes with soft hands
Let the ball drop near your feet

drills.name: Shadow Forward Defence
how_to: Stand in batting stance without a ball
Step forward and simulate a straight bat defence
Focus on head position and balance
Repeat slowly with perfect technique
drills.progression: Add a mirror or video to self-check technique
drills.safety: No ball used, safe for all ages

drills.name: Drop Ball Defence Drill
how_to: Partner stands 4–5 meters away
Partner drops the ball underarm
Step forward and defend with a straight bat
Let the ball fall near your feet
drills.safety: Use soft or tennis ball only

CUT_SHOT.name: Cut Shot
CUT_SHOT.played_to_length: Short and wide outside off stump
CUT_SHOT.description: An attacking back-foot shot played to short and wide balls through the off side

steps: Identify the short and wide delivery early
Move the back foot quickly back and across
Transfer weight onto the back foot
Keep the head still and eyes on the ball
Swing the bat horizontally using the hands
Guide the ball late through point or backward point
key_points: Use the top hand for control

drills.name: Shadow Cut Shot
how_to: Coach calls out 'short'
Move back and across without a ball
Simulate a controlled cut shot
Focus on foot movement and balance

drills.name: Soft Ball Cut Drill
how_to: Coach throws soft balls short and wide
Move back quickly and play the cut shot
Keep the ball along the ground

PULL_SHOT.name: Pull Shot
PULL_SHOT.played_to_length: Short or short-of-length on leg side
PULL_SHOT.description: An attacking shot played to short balls using back-foot movement and horizontal bat swing

steps: Move back and across onto the back foot
Rotate hips slightly towards leg side
Keep head still and eyes on the ball
Swing the bat horizontally at waist height
Follow through in a controlled manner

drills.name: Shadow Pull Shot
how_to: Stand in batting stance
Move back and simulate pull shot motion
Focus on hip rotation and balance

drills.name: Tennis Ball Pull Drill
how_to: Coach throws tennis ball short on leg side
Move back and pull along the ground
Focus on timing rather than power
